chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sally J Herda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete the Drug Treatment Court program, pay restitution and comply with program requirements.
Cash bail applied to restitution for victim as stated in DTC Diversion Contract.

Cash bail applied to restitution.  Restitution to be paid to Emily H. from Case #14CF739 and to be paid before costs or fines.
09/22/16 PER REVIEW BY DA, RESTITUTION FOR EMILY H. ($884.00) WAS PAID IN FULL PRIOR TO SENTENCING. RESTITUTION FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY ($1,362.00) TO BE PAID AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.   Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

Dated 09/21/16, from the State to Judge Carter, requesting amendment of JOC with regard to restitution.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.

Defendant Sally J Herda in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Emily H. makes statements.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $1,362.00 to Emily H. for Case #14CF739 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant


**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**
Sentencing hearing on July 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Sally J Herda in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant remains compliant with the program. Graduation is scheduled for 06/22/16.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sally J Herda in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  Restitution is ordered on this case to victim in the amount of $884.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted on this case and Defendant's other cases). Court converts bail on this case to $1,500.00 signature bond.
